data.title: Alternative Barnsley
data.meta_description: Posts about Rolo Tomassi written by alternativebarnsley
data.text:
Based in Sheffield city centre and now in its sixth year, Tramlines has become huge, attracting festival goers from across the country as well as plenty of locals. Friday afternoon saw floods of people trawling through the city with suitcases, with crowded pubs and beer gardens filled with discussions about check-in times and excitement for … Continue reading →

It is approximately a year and a half ago that I was approached by Barnsley Museums to put together a playlist of Barnsley music for their sound archives in the then yet-to-be-opened Experience Barnsley Museum. I submitted around forty acts from the last fifty years, including folk, post-punk, rock and as well as handful of … Continue reading →

Body Hound, the instrumental ‘prog-metal’ band featuring ex-members of Rolo Tomassi and Antares will release their debut 6-track EP ‘Rhombus Now’ this week. Body Hound features Calvin Rhodes (ex-Antares) on guitar, Joseph Thorpe and Joseph Nicholson (ex-Rolo Tomassi) on guitar and bass respectively, and Ryan Bright (Redmist Destruction) on drums. The band formed nearly two … Continue reading →

LIVE REVIEW: CROOKED WAY FESTIVAL, PONTEFRACT PARK, SAT 1st JUNE by ROSEANNA HANSON Whilst Jason was away having fun at the Punk Pub Crawl in Elsecar, I volunteered to get a backstage spot at Crooked Ways Festival at Pontefract Park to see what it was all about. To say that the festival is only in … Continue reading →

Barnsley’s Cocean have been described as melodious, beautiful, heartfelt pop, wonderfully infectious and a band brimming with ideas. However, until now, I’d never actually heard any of their material before, but going on those descriptions I was definitely looking forward to it. Having formed back in 2007, the five piece have garnered a number of … Continue reading →
